creator: larsen007@web.de
text:
Hello,

when using remoteTofile and todir attribute together, I get the following 
exception:

  java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1

It is stated in the manual that the remoteTofile attribute is an alternative to 
todir, but I think it should be handled by Ant if the user specifies both 
attributes.


Lars

What behavior do you expect from combining these attributes that are documented
as mutually exclusive?
creator: mbenson@apache.org

text:
I thought that I had to specify the remotedir with "todir" and the name I 
wanted my original filename converted to (e.g. test.html -> index.html) with 
"remoteTofile".

It´s ok the way it is, but instead of throwing an meaningless exception it 
would be better to give an accurate error message.
creator: larsen007@web.de

text:
I agree a better error message is needed.  To cause the attributes to function
in concert would require more effort than I am prepared to give this (unfamiliar
to me) task, but I can certainly improve the user experience by detecting
illegal attribute combinations in this task.
creator: mbenson@apache.org

text:
I have no experience with what you're trying to do or with the scp task, but I
would think it would be better accomplished by using a mapper to rename the
destination file.
